summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel, likely from the New York field office, discussing the transfer and copying of a 12 TB hard drive containing digital evidence. The email shows logistical coordination for handling large volumes of data related to an investigation, with references to sending items to 'Southern' (likely the Southern District of New York).

persons.name: Sunny Drescher
persons.role: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Appears as the sender/recipient in an email chain about copying data from a 12 TB drive. Identified as a contractor for the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and an FBI forensic examiner.

events.title: Request for 12 TB Drive
events.description: An FBI employee emails a colleague asking if a 12 TB hard drive has been returned from 'Southern' (likely SDNY), as they have 5 more items to send and need storage.

events.title: Data Copying Process
events.description: An FBI forensic examiner reports they have started copying data from the 12 TB drive onto a thumb drive, with an estimated 4 more hours to complete.

keyFacts: The document references a 12 TB hard drive containing evidence that was sent to or from 'Southern', likely the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
FBI forensic personnel were actively copying data from this large drive onto a thumb drive, indicating ongoing evidence processing.
The email chain shows logistical coordination within the FBI's New York field office regarding the handling of digital evidence in an investigation.
The document is marked 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' referencing specific paragraphs, indicating it contains sensitive information.
The correspondence suggests the investigation involved substantial digital evidence requiring specialized forensic handling.
